name: clipseq-rna-binding-proteins
title: CLIP-seq RNA-Protein Interaction Analysis
description: Comprehensive CLIP-seq analysis pipeline for studying RNA-protein interactions and identifying RNA binding protein (RBP) target sites. Supports multiple peak calling methods, motif discovery, and UMI-based deduplication. Samplesheet format: `sample,fastq`
content:
CLIPseq - RNA-Protein Interaction Analysis

End-to-end bioinformatics pipeline for analyzing CLIP (Cross-Linking and Immunoprecipitation) sequencing data to identify RNA binding protein (RBP) targets and binding sites. Integrates quality control, mapping, crosslink identification, peak calling, and motif discovery.

What is CLIP-seq?

CLIP-seq combines UV cross-linking and immunoprecipitation to capture RNA-protein interactions in vivo, enabling precise mapping of RBP binding sites at nucleotide resolution and revealing post-transcriptional regulatory networks.

Key Features

  • Comprehensive Workflow: QC to peak calling
  • UMI Deduplication: Remove PCR duplicates
  • Multiple Peak Callers: iCount, Paraclu, PureCLIP, Piranha
  • Crosslink Identification: Precise binding site mapping
  • Motif Discovery: DREME for sequence enrichment
  • Library Complexity: Preseq estimation

Pipeline Workflow

  1. Quality Control: FastQC assessment of raw reads
  2. Adapter Trimming: Cutadapt for quality and adapter removal
  3. Library Complexity: Preseq complexity curves
  4. Pre-mapping: Bowtie2 to rRNA/tRNA for contamination
  5. Genome Mapping: STAR alignment to reference
  6. UMI Deduplication: UMI-tools for PCR duplicate removal
  7. Regional Distribution: RSeQC for feature annotation
  8. Crosslink Identification: BEDTools for binding sites
  9. Coverage Tracks: Bedgraph generation
  10. Peak Calling: Multiple algorithms for binding peaks
  11. Motif Discovery: DREME for enriched sequences

Scientific Applications

  • RNA-Protein Interactions: Map RBP binding sites
  • Post-Transcriptional Regulation: Study RNA processing
  • Splicing Regulation: Identify splicing factors
  • RNA Stability: Characterize ARE-binding proteins
  • Disease Mechanisms: RBP dysregulation in disease

Peak Calling Methods

  • iCount: Crosslink-centric peak calling
  • Paraclu: Clustering-based approach
  • PureCLIP: Hidden Markov model method
  • Piranha: Bin-based statistical approach

Analysis Features

  • Nucleotide Resolution: Precise binding site mapping
  • Quality Metrics: Comprehensive QC throughout
  • Regional Annotation: UTRs, exons, introns coverage
  • Reproducibility: Compare biological replicates
  • Motif Enrichment: Discover binding preferences

Advantages

  • Multi-Tool Integration: Best algorithms combined
  • Comprehensive QC: Quality at every step
  • UMI Support: Accurate quantification
  • Reproducible: Containerized workflow
  • Well-Documented: Extensive guidance

Input Requirements

  • FASTQ Files: CLIP-seq sequencing reads
  • Sample Sheet: Sample metadata
  • Reference Genome: FASTA and GTF annotation
  • Optional: UMI pattern, rRNA sequences

Main Outputs

  • Binding Peaks: RBP binding site coordinates
  • Crosslink Sites: Nucleotide-level binding positions
  • Coverage Tracks: Genome browser visualization
  • Motif Results: Enriched sequence motifs
  • Regional Distribution: Feature annotation statistics
  • QC Reports: MultiQC comprehensive summary

Perfect for: CLIP-seq • RNA-Protein Interactions • RBP Binding • Post-Transcriptional Regulation • Motif Discovery
